justification: The article notes that “risk-taking measured using the Balloon Analogue Risk Task (BART)” was analysed when relating testosterone levels to risky decisions.
It states that “exogenous testosterone increased risk-taking in the Iowa Gambling Task (IGT) in a group of women,” identifying the IGT as the behavioural instrument for risk taking.

measured_by: Binary gamble choice task with sure vs gamble options
justification: In the Methods the authors describe an experimental ‘risk-taking task’ where “Participants made a choice between two options where one was a sure option and another one a gamble option with different probabilities.”

measured_by: WTA/WTP ratio in the Endowment Task
justification: For the Endowment effect task, participants stated minimum selling prices (WTA) and maximum buying prices (WTP); the authors analyse the “WTA/WTP ratio” as the quantitative measure of the endowment effect.
The text refers to the “2D:4D ratio, which has been proposed as a proxy for prenatal hormone exposure,” indicating this bodily ratio is the operational measure of prenatal testosterone.

Hormone Profiles section specifies that “Testosterone and cortisol serum concentrations were analyzed by electrochemiluminescence immunoassays (ECLIA),” defining how circulating testosterone was measured.
